dialogueTree.title: Door, Apartment #28: "This door is made of metal and appe..."
dialogueTree.english: This door is made of metal and appears to be reinforced. Someone here really values their security.
dialogueTree.polish: Drzwi są zrobione z metalu i wyglądają na wzmocnione. Ktoś tu naprawdę ceni sobie bezpieczeństwo.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Дзверы зроблены з металу і выглядаюць узмоцненымі. Хтосьці тут сапраўды шануе бяспеку.

links.title: Smoker on the Balcony: ""Yes?" A handsome young man hums wi..."
links.english: "Yes?" A handsome young man hums with a cigarette in his hand. "Are you looking for me, gendarme?"
links.polish: „Tak?” – zagaja przystojny młody mężczyzna z papierosem w dłoni. „Szukał mnie pan, żandarmie?”
links.belarusian: "Так?" — пачынае прыгожы малады мужчына з цыгарэтай у руцэ. "Вы мяне шукалі, жандарм?"

links.title: You: "Knock."
links.english: Knock.
links.polish: Zapukaj.
links.belarusian: Пастукай.

links.title: Door, Apartment #28: "No one answers."
links.english: No one answers.
links.polish: Nikt nie odpowiada.
links.belarusian: Ніхто не адказвае.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's go. There's nothing to do he..."
links.english: "Let's go. There's nothing to do here for us anymore."
links.polish: „Chodźmy. Nic tu po nas”.
links.belarusian: "Пойдзем. Нам тут няма чаго рабіць".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's go. There's nothing to do he..."
links.english: "Let's go. There's nothing to do here for us anymore."
links.polish: „Chodźmy. Nic tu po nas”.
links.belarusian: "Пайшлі. Няма чаго нам тут рабіць".

links.title: Door, Apartment #28: "Nothing do to here anymore..."
links.english: Nothing do to here anymore...
links.polish: Nie ma tu już nic do roboty...
links.belarusian: Тут больш няма чаго рабіць...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should talk to him." The lieute..."
links.english: "We should talk to him." The lieutenant nods at the man standing right next to the door.
links.polish: „Powinniśmy z nim porozmawiać” – stwierdza porucznik, wskazując skinieniem głowy mężczyznę stojącego przy drzwiach.
links.belarusian: "Мы павінны з ім пагаварыць", — сцвярджае лейтэнант, ківаючы галавой у бок мужчыны, які стаіць каля дзвярэй.

links.title: Logic: "The man you're looking for is stand..."
links.english: The man you're looking for is standing right next to you. You should talk to him.
links.polish: Mężczyzna, którego szukasz, stoi tuż obok ciebie. Powinieneś z nim porozmawiać.
links.belarusian: Мужчына, якога ты шукаеш, стаіць зусім побач з табой. Табе варта пагаварыць з ім.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should return tomorrow -- tomor..."
links.english: "We should return tomorrow -- tomorrow at 21.00," the lieutenant reminds you.
links.polish: „Powinniśmy wrócić tu jutro o godzinie 21:00” – przypomina ci porucznik.
links.belarusian: "Мы павінны вярнуцца сюды заўтра а 21:00", — нагадвае табе лейтэнант.

links.title: Logic: "Looks like he isn't home. You shoul..."
links.english: Looks like he isn't home. You should come back tomorrow evening, after 21.00.
links.polish: Zdaje się, że nie ma go w domu. Powinieneś wrócić jutro wieczorem, po 21:00.
links.belarusian: Здаецца, яго няма дома. Ты павінен вярнуцца заўтра вечарам, пасля 21:00.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should return in the evening --..."
links.english: "We should return in the evening -- at 21.00 the earliest."
links.polish: „Powinniśmy wrócić tu wieczorem – najwcześniej o 21:00”.
links.belarusian: "Мы павінны вярнуцца сюды ўвечары – не раней за 21:00".

links.title: Logic: "Looks like he isn't home. You shoul..."
links.english: Looks like he isn't home. You should come back later, after 21.00.
links.polish: Zdaje się, że nie ma go w domu. Powinieneś wrócić później, po 21:00.
links.belarusian: Здаецца, яго няма дома. Ты павінен вярнуцца пазней, пасля 21:00.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like the young man we're loo..."
links.english: "Looks like the young man we're looking for isn't home. I think our best chance to catch him is in the evening." He looks around, taking in the cold spring air.
links.polish: „Wygląda na to, że młodego mężczyzny, którego szukamy, nie ma w domu. Myślę, że zastać go tu można wieczorem” – stwierdza porucznik, rozglądając się wokół i robiąc głęboki wdech zimnego, wiosennego powietrza.
links.belarusian: "Выглядае на тое, што маладога чалавека, якога шукаем, няма дома. Думаю, яго можна тут застаць вечарам", — зазначае лейтэнант, азіраючыся навокал і робячы глыбокі ўдых халоднага, вясновага паветра.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should return tomorrow after we..."
links.english: "We should return tomorrow after we have finished with our day's work -- how about 21.00, sound good?"
links.polish: „Powinniśmy wrócić jutro, gdy załatwimy wszystkie zaplanowane na ten dzień sprawy – może o 21:00?”
links.belarusian: "Мы павінны вярнуцца заўтра, калі вырашым усе запланаваныя на гэты дзень справы – магчыма, а 21:00?"

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.english: "What do you mean?"
links.polish: „Co masz na myśli?”
links.belarusian: "Што ты маеш на ўвазе?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The smoker on the balcony. This is..."
links.english: "The smoker on the balcony. This is why we're here, right? He might know something about the murder. So, tomorrow 21.00?"
links.polish: „Palacz na balkonie. To dlatego tu jesteśmy, prawda? Może wiedzieć coś o morderstwie. Więc wrócimy tu jutro o 21:00?”
links.belarusian: "Курэц на балконе. Таму мы тут, праўда? Магчыма, ён ведае нешта пра забойства. Дык вернемся сюды заўтра ў 21:00?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Suddenly he's a little worried abou..."
links.english: Suddenly he's a little worried about your memory...
links.polish: Nagle martwi się nieco o twoją pamięć...
links.belarusian: Раптам крыху турбуецца пра вашу памяць...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Don't worry, it's (mostly) all stil..."
links.english: Don't worry, it's (mostly) all still here. You can remember things. You *got* this.
links.polish: Spokojnie, wciąż nią (w większości) dysponujesz. Pamiętasz rzeczy. *Dasz radę*.
links.belarusian: Спакойна, усё яшчэ ёй (у большасці) распаражджаешся. Памятаеш рэчы. *Ты справішся*.

links.title: You: ""Sounds good. Tomorrow 21.00.""
links.english: "Sounds good. Tomorrow 21.00."
links.polish: „W porządku. Jutro o 21:00”.
links.belarusian: "У парадку. Заўтра а 21:00".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Tomorrow 21.00, right here, apartm..."
links.english: "Tomorrow 21.00, right here, apartment #28." He writes it down into his little notebook. "Good. Let's go."
links.polish: „Juro, 21:00 – tutaj, mieszkanie numer 28” – zapisuje wszystko w swoim małym notatniku. „Dobrze. W drogę”.
links.belarusian: "Юра, 21:00 – тут, кватэра нумар 28" – занатоўвае ўсё ў сваім маленькім нататніку. "Добра. У дарогу".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Damn. Turns out it's quite tricky f..."
links.english: Damn. Turns out it's quite tricky finding someone in a big apartment building... Don't worry. You'll get him!
links.polish: Cholera. Okazuje się, że nie tak łatwo znaleźć kogoś w dużym apartamentowcu... Bez obaw. Dorwiesz go jeszcze!
links.belarusian: Халера. Аказваецца, што не так лёгка знайсці кагосьці ў вялікай шматпавярхоўцы... Не хвалюйся. Ты яшчэ яго зловіш!

links.title: Logic: "Remember: tomorrow. He's *probably*..."
links.english: Remember: tomorrow. He's *probably* gone for today.
links.polish: Pamiętaj – jutro. Dziś już go tu *zapewne* nie ma.
links.belarusian: Памятай – заўтра. Сёння яго тут *верагодна* ўжо няма.

links.title: You: ""I don't think I can make it.""
links.english: "I don't think I can make it."
links.polish: „Chyba będę akurat zajęty”.
links.belarusian: "Мабыць, я якраз буду заняты".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's alright, we don't have to be..."
links.english: "It's alright, we don't have to be here 21.00 sharp, I just need to write something down in my notebook." He has already opened the little blue book.
links.polish: „W porządku, nie musimy tu być punktualnie o 21:00 – po prostu muszę zapisać jakąś godzinę” – stwierdza, otwierając swój mały niebieski notatnik.
links.belarusian: "У парадку, нам не трэба быць тут а 21:00 дакладна – проста мушу пазначыць нейкі час", – зазначае ён, адчыняючы свой маленькі сіні нататнік.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Tomorrow evening, right here, apar..."
links.english: "Tomorrow evening, right here, apartment #28. Good. Let's go."
links.polish: „Juro wieczorem – tutaj, mieszkanie numer 28. W drogę”.
links.belarusian: "Юро вечарам — тут, кватэра нумар 28. У дарогу".

links.title: Logic: "Looks like he isn't home. You shoul..."
links.english: Looks like he isn't home. You should come back tomorrow evening, after 21.00.
links.polish: Zdaje się, że nie ma go w domu. Powinieneś wrócić jutro wieczorem, po 21:00.
links.belarusian: Здаецца, што яго няма дома. Ты павінен вярнуцца заўтра ўвечары, пасля 21:00.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like the young man we're loo..."
links.english: "Looks like the young man we're looking for isn't home. I think our best chance to catch him is in the evening." He looks around, taking in the cold spring air.
links.polish: „Wygląda na to, że młodego mężczyzny, którego szukamy, nie ma w domu. Myślę, że zastać go tu można wieczorem” – stwierdza porucznik, rozglądając się wokół i robiąc głęboki wdech zimnego, wiosennego powietrza.
links.belarusian: "Выглядае на тое, што маладога чалавека, якога мы шукаем, няма дома. Думаю, што сустрэць яго тут можна будзе вечарам", — кажа лейтэнант, аглядаючыся вакол і глыбока ўдыхаючы халоднае, веснавое паветра.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should return tonight after we..."
links.english: "We should return tonight after we have finished with our day's work -- how about 21.00, sound good?"
links.polish: „Powinniśmy wrócić tu wieczorem, gdy załatwimy wszystkie zaplanowane na dziś sprawy – może o 21:00?”
links.belarusian: "Павінны вярнуцца сюды вечарам, калі вырашым усе запланаваныя на сёння справы — можа, у 21:00?"

links.title: You: ""What are you talking about?""
links.english: "What are you talking about?"
links.polish: „O czym ty mówisz?”
links.belarusian: "Пра што ты кажаш?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The smoker on the balcony. This is..."
links.english: "The smoker on the balcony. This is why we're here, right? He might know something about the murder. So, tonight at 21.00?"
links.polish: „Palacz na balkonie. To dlatego tu jesteśmy, prawda? Może wiedzieć coś o morderstwie. Więc wrócimy tu dziś o 21:00?”
links.belarusian: "Курэц на балконе. Вось чаму мы тут, праўда? Магчыма, ён ведае нешта пра забойства. Так што мы вернемся сюды сёння а 21:00?"

links.title: You: ""Sounds good. Tonight at 21.00.""
links.english: "Sounds good. Tonight at 21.00."
links.polish: „Brzmi dobrze. Dziś o 21:00”.
links.belarusian: "Гучыць добра. Сёння ў 21:00".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Tonight at 21.00, right here, apar..."
links.english: "Tonight at 21.00, right here, apartment #28." He writes it down into his little notebook. "Good. Let's go."
links.polish: „Dziś, 21:00 – tutaj, mieszkanie numer 28” – zapisuje wszystko w swoim małym notatniku. „Dobrze. W drogę”.
links.belarusian: "Сёння, 21:00 — тут, кватэра нумар 28" — запісвае ўсё ў сваім маленькім нататніку. "Добра. У дарогу".

links.title: You: ""I don't think I can make it.""
links.english: "I don't think I can make it."
links.polish: „Chyba będę akurat zajęty”.
links.belarusian: "Пэўна, я буду якраз заняты".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's alright, we don't have to be..."
links.english: "It's alright, we don't have to be here 21.00 sharp, I just need to write something down in my notebook." He has already opened the little blue book.
links.polish: „W porządku, nie musimy tu być punktualnie o 21:00 – po prostu muszę zapisać jakąś godzinę” – stwierdza, otwierając swój mały niebieski notatnik.
links.belarusian: "У парадку, нам не трэба быць тут дакладна ў 21:00 — проста мне трэба запісаць нейкі час", — адзначае ён, адкрываючы свой маленькі сіні нататнік.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Tonight, right here, apartment #28..."
links.english: "Tonight, right here, apartment #28. Good. Let's go."
links.polish: „Dziś wieczorem – tutaj, mieszkanie numer 28. W drogę”.
links.belarusian: "Сёння вечарам – тут, кватэра нумар 28. У дарогу".

links.title: Logic: "Looks like he isn't home. You shoul..."
links.english: Looks like he isn't home. You should come back later, after 21.00.
links.polish: Zdaje się, że nie ma go w domu. Powinieneś wrócić później, po 21:00.
links.belarusian: Здаецца, яго няма дома. Табе варта вярнуцца пазней, пасля 21:00.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.english: [Leave.]
links.polish: [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: [Адыдзі].

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's see if anyone's home. Knock..."
links.english: "Let's see if anyone's home. Knock on the door."
links.polish: „Sprawdźmy, czy ktoś jest w domu. Zapukaj do drzwi”.
links.belarusian: "Паглядзім, ці ёсць хто дома. Пастукай у дзверы".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Number twenty eight... This is wher..."
links.english: Number twenty eight... This is where the cleaning lady said the smoker on the balcony lives.
links.polish: Numer dwadzieścia osiem... Sprzątaczka mówiła, że to tu mieszka balkonowy palacz.
links.belarusian: Нумар дваццаць восем... Прыбіральшчыца казала, што тут жыве балконны курэц.
